The main insight of this section is a weakened closure property for monotone and somewhere dense graph classes, established in the lemma below. Hence, if we have an oracle for #â€‹ColMatchâ€‹(ğ’¢)#ColMatchğ’¢\#\textsc{ColMatch}(\mathcal{G}), then we can compute the value ofÂ (8), while #â€‹ğ–§ğ—ˆğ—†â€‹((Hrâ€‹â™¯â€‹Ï,cÏ)â†’(Hrâ€‹â™¯â€‹Ïƒ,cÏƒ))#ğ–§ğ—ˆğ—†â†’superscriptğ»ğ‘Ÿâ™¯ğœŒsubscriptğ‘ğœŒsuperscriptğ»ğ‘Ÿâ™¯ğœsubscriptğ‘ğœ\#\mathsf{Hom}((H^{r}\raisebox{0.86108pt}{\rotatebox[origin={c}]{-15.0}{$\sharp$}}\rho,c_{\rho})\to(H^{r}\raisebox{0.86108pt}{\rotatebox[origin={c}]{-15.0}{$\sharp$}}\sigma,c_{\sigma})) can obviously be computed in a time that is a function of |H|ğ»|H| and rğ‘Ÿr.
Thus, by letting ğ–¼ğ—ˆğ–¾ğ–¿ğ–¿â€‹(Ï):=aâ€‹(Ï)â‹…#â€‹ğ–§ğ—ˆğ—†â€‹((Hrâ€‹â™¯â€‹Ï,cÏ)â†’(Gr,cr))assignğ–¼ğ—ˆğ–¾ğ–¿ğ–¿ğœŒâ‹…ğ‘ğœŒ#ğ–§ğ—ˆğ—†â†’superscriptğ»ğ‘Ÿâ™¯ğœŒsubscriptğ‘ğœŒsuperscriptğºğ‘Ÿsuperscriptğ‘ğ‘Ÿ\mathsf{coeff}(\rho):=a(\rho)\cdot\#\mathsf{Hom}((H^{r}\raisebox{0.86108pt}{\rotatebox[origin={c}]{-15.0}{$\sharp$}}\rho,c_{\rho})\to(G^{r},c^{r})), in FPT time we obtain a system of linear equations with unknowns ğ–¼ğ—ˆğ–¾ğ–¿ğ–¿â€‹(Ï)ğ–¼ğ—ˆğ–¾ğ–¿ğ–¿ğœŒ\mathsf{coeff}(\rho) and whose matrix is MHrsubscriptğ‘€superscriptğ»ğ‘ŸM_{H^{r}}, seeÂ (5). By LemmaÂ 33 MHrsubscriptğ‘€superscriptğ»ğ‘ŸM_{H^{r}} is nonsingular, hence by solving the system we can retrieve: Since aâ€‹(âŠ¤)â‰ 0ğ‘top0a(\top)\neq 0, we can divide by aâ€‹(âŠ¤)ğ‘topa(\top) and recover #â€‹ğ–§ğ—ˆğ—†â€‹((Hr,ğ—‚ğ–½Hr)â†’(Gr,cr))#ğ–§ğ—ˆğ—†â†’superscriptğ»ğ‘Ÿsubscriptğ—‚ğ–½superscriptğ»ğ‘Ÿsuperscriptğºğ‘Ÿsuperscriptğ‘ğ‘Ÿ\#\mathsf{Hom}((H^{r},\mathsf{id}_{H^{r}})\to(G^{r},c^{r})) as desired. This concludes the parameterized reduction to #â€‹ColMatchâ€‹(ğ’¢)#ColMatchğ’¢\#\textsc{ColMatch}(\mathcal{G}) and proves the thesis.
âˆ With the hardness results for #â€‹ColMatchâ€‹(ğ’¢)#ColMatchğ’¢\#\textsc{ColMatch}(\mathcal{G}) above, we can finally obtain our complexity dichotomy for #â€‹Matchâ€‹(ğ’¢)#Matchğ’¢\#\textsc{Match}(\mathcal{G}). First, we prove: Let ğ’¢ğ’¢\mathcal{G} be a monotone somewhere dense class of graphs. Then #â€‹Matchâ€‹(ğ’¢)#Matchğ’¢\#\textsc{Match}(\mathcal{G}) is #â€‹ğ–¶â€‹#ğ–¶delimited-[]1\#\mathsf{W}-hard and, assuming ETH, cannot be solved in time fâ€‹(k)â‹…|G|oâ€‹(k/logâ¡k)â‹…ğ‘“ğ‘˜superscriptğºğ‘œğ‘˜ğ‘˜f(k)\cdot|G|^{o(k/\log k)} for any function fğ‘“f. A well-known application of inclusion-exclusion (see, e.g., [15, LemmaÂ 1.34]) yields a parameterized reduction from #â€‹ColMatchâ€‹(ğ’¢)#ColMatchğ’¢\#\textsc{ColMatch}(\mathcal{G}) to #â€‹Matchâ€‹(ğ’¢â€²)#Matchsuperscriptğ’¢â€²\#\textsc{Match}(\mathcal{G}^{\prime}) that preserves the parameter, where ğ’¢â€²superscriptğ’¢â€²\mathcal{G}^{\prime} is the class of all subgraphs of ğ’¢ğ’¢\mathcal{G}. By monotonicity ğ’¢â€²=ğ’¢superscriptğ’¢â€²ğ’¢\mathcal{G}^{\prime}=\mathcal{G}, so the claim of LemmaÂ 36 holds for #â€‹Matchâ€‹(ğ’¢)#Matchğ’¢\#\textsc{Match}(\mathcal{G}), too.
âˆ Finally, we obtain: Let ğ’¢ğ’¢\mathcal{G} be a monotone class of graphs and assume that ETH holds. Then #â€‹Matchâ€‹(ğ’¢)#Matchğ’¢\#\textsc{Match}(\mathcal{G}) is fixed-parameter tractable if and only if ğ’¢ğ’¢\mathcal{G} is nowhere dense. In particular, if ğ’¢ğ’¢\mathcal{G} is nowhere dense then #â€‹Matchâ€‹(ğ’¢)#Matchğ’¢\#\textsc{Match}(\mathcal{G}) can be solved in time fâ€‹(k)â‹…|Vâ€‹(G)|1+oâ€‹(1)â‹…ğ‘“ğ‘˜superscriptğ‘‰ğº1ğ‘œ1f(k)\cdot|V(G)|^{1+o(1)} for some computable functionÂ fğ‘“f; otherwise #â€‹Matchâ€‹(ğ’¢)#Matchğ’¢\#\textsc{Match}(\mathcal{G}) cannot be solved in time fâ€‹(k)â‹…|G|oâ€‹(k/logâ¡k)â‹…ğ‘“ğ‘˜superscriptğºğ‘œğ‘˜ğ‘˜f(k)\cdot|G|^{o(k/\log k)} for any function fğ‘“f. Immediate from TheoremÂ 18 and TheoremÂ 37.
âˆ Unless #â€‹P=P#PP\#\mathrm{P}=\mathrm{P}, CorollaryÂ 38 / TheoremÂ 2 cannot be strengthened to achieve polynomial time tractability of #â€‹Matchâ€‹(ğ’¢)#Matchğ’¢\#\textsc{Match}(\mathcal{G}) for nowhere dense and monotone ğ’¢ğ’¢\mathcal{G}. Let indeed ğ’¢ğ’¢\mathcal{G} be the class of all K8subscriptğ¾8K_{8}-minor-free graphs. Then ğ’¢ğ’¢\mathcal{G} is clearly monotone, and since it does not contain the subdivisions of cliques larger than 777, it is also nowhere dense by LemmaÂ 16. However, as shown recently by Curticapean and XiaÂ , counting perfect matchings (i.e., kğ‘˜k-matchings with k=n/2ğ‘˜ğ‘›2k=n/2) in K8subscriptğ¾8K_{8}-minor-free graphs is #â€‹P#P\#\mathrm{P}-hard.
